title: 109_hr5321
content: The Act titled "Access to Better Choice in Dialysis Act of 2006" allows for a Medicare pilot project for more frequent hemodialysis treatment. The "Access to Better Choice in Dialysis Act of 2006" mandates a 5-year pilot project by the Secretary of Health and Human Services to assess the impact of increasing payment for hemodialysis treatment beyond 3 times per week. The pilot project outlines specific payment increases for additional sessions per week. The pilot program for hemodialysis treatment includes specific payment increases for additional sessions per week, with funding limitations set for each year of operation. Expenditures are capped at $90,000,000 by the fifth year, funded from the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund. The pilot program for hemodialysis treatment includes payment increases for more sessions per week, funded from the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund. The Secretary will collect data on the impact of higher frequency treatments on health status, healthcare utilization, and patients' working status. The pilot program for hemodialysis treatment involves increased tax payments, reduced Medicare payments, and reports to Congress on the clinical and financial impact of more frequent treatments. The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission will evaluate the findings and assess the desirability of expanded Medicare payment for more frequent hemodialysis treatment. The final report will analyze the desirability of expanded Medicare payment for more frequent hemodialysis treatment. Definitions include full composite rate, hemodialysis treatment, and Secretary of Health and Human Services.
